product.productName: Taylors spiced apple wrapped tea bags, 20 pack -
product.productDescription: Created in partnership with Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. At Taylors of Harrogate, we know flavour - and nobody understands plants quite like the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. Now our experts have worked in partnership to create some remarkable infusions using the very finest fruits and herbs. They're positively bursting with taste and goodness. We've blended sweet apple pieces with the warmth of spices - punchy ginger root, cloves, and star anise to make a deeply satisfying infusion. Our infusions use only natural ingredients, are caffeine free and contain no added sugar.

Many years ago Head Brewer, John Woodhouse - invited his team to sample his latest creation. On rising to go, his mischievous companion, believing a walk was imminent, tangled his owner up with the lead and Woodhouse fell upon the perfect name for this new beer. Tanglefoot is a golden ale with hints of melon and pear developed from fermentation. Ideal for steak and ale pies. See - Light copper, golden amber. Smell - Fruity, scented hop, cereal. Taste - Crisp/sweet, spicy overtones

Domecq 1820 has a smooth taste with a long finish and hints of vanilla, raisins, almonds and hazelnuts. Domecq 1820 marks the year when Don Pedro Domecq's vision was born - a pioneering vision to create Spain's finest wines and spirits. Two years later, the house of Domecq was established. Today Domecq 1820 is made in Malaga, in southern Spain, using the solera system - a centuries-old method where aged brandy is infused with younger brandies, ensuring consistent quality. It is aged in oak barrels for two years.

product.productName: Brew Dog Dead Pony Club Pale Ale -
product.productDescription: Dead pony club Californian pale ale. This Californian Pale Ale packs a huge hoppy punch. A 21st century low amplitude, high voltage hop hit. Some people say slow is good. We believe fast is better. Being shot from a Hoppy Howitzer beats the hell out of trotting round a submissive paddock. That's why the internal combustion engine got mounted onto two wheels. Screw down the throttle and listen for that dull banshee howl floating back from those malted mufflers. Drink fast, live fast, sleep late and rip it up down empty streets. This pale ale is chopped, tuned and ready to roll. Fuel up and hold tight, this little thoroughbred kicks like a mule. Walk tall, rock out and learn to speak craft beer. At BrewDog we brew uncompromising, bold and irreverent beer, beer with a soul and a purpose. Our approach has the same contempt of the mass beer market that the old-school punks had for pop-culture. BrewDog is a modern day rebellion against faceless corporate bureaucracy and the bland, soulless beer they industrially produce. Ditch the mainstream and say hello to BrewDog.

New Improved Taste. Great taste more naturally. Twice the wheatgerm goodness of brown. Source of fibre. Rich in calcium. No artificial preservatives. Suitable for vegetarians and vegans. Medium sliced white bread made with 50% wholemeal flour (29% of the baked loaf) with added wheatgerm&calcium. Why should I buy Hovis Best of Both.......? At Hovis we add nothing but the best, which is why we add extra wheatgerm to our Best of Both. Wheatgerm is the natural source of life for wheatgrass and is a powerhouse of nutrients. It contains 23 nutrients, more per ounce than any other vegetable or grain. These include potassium, iron, riboflavin, calcium, zinc, magnesium, folic acid, phosphorus, thiamine and vitamins A,E, B1&B3. At Hovis we believe that natural is best, which is why we promise never to use artificial preservatives. We add wheatgerm back in to our delicious Best of Both loaves to deliver an improved taste with twice the wheatgerm goodness of brown bread. The result is a delicious loaf which is rich in calcium and a source of fibre, with all the freshness you\u2019d expect from Hovis - just more naturally. So why not put some natural goodness back into your family\u2019s diet? Hovis, great taste more naturally. If you enjoy the great taste of Hovis Best of Both, why not try our delicious Hovis Wholemeal loaf? To help you enjoy your Hovis loaf even more, why not be inspired by some exciting recipe ideas? Visit us at www.hovisbakery.co.uk to find out more. You can even find out more about the magic of wheat germ!

product.productName: Hovis Best of Both - little one -
product.productDescription: New improved taste. Great taste more naturally. Twice the wheatgerm goodness of brown. Source of fibre. Rich in calcium. No artificial preservatives. Suitable for vegetarians&vegans. Why should I buy Hovis Best of Both.......? At Hovis we add nothing but the best, which is why we add extra wheatgerm to our Best of Both. Wheatgerm is the natural source of life for wheatgrass and is a powerhouse of nutrients. It contains 23 nutrients, more per ounce than any other vegetable or grain. These include potassium, iron, riboflavin, calcium, zinc, magnesium, folic acid, phosphorus, thiamine and vitamins A,E, B1&B3. At Hovis we believe that natural is best, which is why we promise never to use artificial preservatives. We add wheatgerm back in to our delicious Best of Both loaves to deliver an improved taste with twice the wheatgerm goodness of brown bread. The result is a delicious loaf which is rich in calcium and a source of fibre, with all the freshness you\u2019d expect from Hovis - just more naturally. So why not put some natural goodness back into your family\u2019s diet? Hovis, great taste more naturally. If you enjoy the great taste of Hovis Best of Both, why not try our delicious Hovis Wholemeal loaf? To help you enjoy your Hovis loaf even more, why not be inspired by some exciting recipe ideas? Visit us at www.hovisbakery.co.uk to find out more. You can even find out more about the magic of wheat germ!

Bollinger is famous for its consistency ofstyle, structure and aromatic complexity. This is a complex and elegant Champagne with a wonderful combination of velvety bubbles and flavours of pear, brioche, spice and fresh walnuts. Bollinger is one of the few remaining independent family owned Champagne houses. Since 1829, this moderately small house has worked tirelessly to acquire the finest vineyard sites, now totalling 163 ha, to guarantee the highest quality wine. The Champagne region of France lies approx 100 miles East of Paris. The chalky soil in this cool northerly climate creates a unique terroir for the Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier grapes. First fermentation takes place in Stainless Steel tanks. After blending, bottling and second fermentation the Special Cuvée will rest for a minimum of three years on its lees to allow the aromatic complexity to fully develop. \u201CBollinger Special Cuvee. Cool, delicate briochey nose. Nice, rich fruit with honeyed undertones, reserve wine richness and texture. Complex, classy.\u201D Antony Rose, Decanter, January 2008.

For Biryani, Pilaff&one-pot dishes. Extra long grains. Grains of truth purity tested. Easy to cook and never sticks. Purity&quality guaranteed. Grand Biryani rice. What is a Biryani? An aromatic one-pot rice curry, full of flavour, mildly spiced - a great treat for a hungry family, and perfect for leftover meats or vegetables. For many years we have been searching for a very special rice to sit alongside our legendary pure basmati. Our long awaited search has finally come to fruition. This is one of the finest rices you will find. What makes this grand rice so grand, is it's beautifully distinctive and unique extra long grains. The robust characteristics make for truly separate grains and the key ingredient in exquisite Biryani and Pilaff dishes, where length of grain matters. Visit Tilda.com for Biryani recipes

As biscuit lovers, we have worked closely with our own nutritionists to bring you a new and exciting choice for breakfast: Belvita Breakfast biscuits are delicious, crunchy biscuits specially designed for breakfast. They are carefully made and gently baked so that as part of a balanced breakfast, the carbohydrates are regularly released over 4 hours to keep you going all morning. Dentist recommended brand. Clinically proven relief and daily protection for sensitive teeth. With fluoride. Powered by Novamin. Strengthens&rehardens enamel. Fresh and clean feeling. Protects against plaque. Novamin restores a protective layer over sensitive areas to shield you from pain. Maintains healthy gums. Maintains natural whiteness. Why use Sensodyne Complete Protection? Sensitivity can be a sign that your teeth are vulnerable due to enamel loss or gum recession. With twice daily brushing, its NovaMin formulation has been developed to help provide sensitive teeth with everything they need. What is tooth sensitivity? Sensitivity can be a sign that your teeth are vulnerable, as dentine becomes exposed due to enamel loss or gum recession. When exposed dentine comes into contact with hot or cold, sweet or sour, or even your toothbrush, it can trigger the nerve inside the tooth causing a short sharp pain. Dentist Recommended Brand*. *Dentists recommend the Sensodyne brand.

Beetroot, parsnip&carrot crisps with a pinch of sea salt. A colourful union of earthy beetroots, sweet carrots and that unsung hero of the Sunday roast: the parsnip - all made to sing with a pinch of sea salt. And if you like these, keep your eyes peeled for our magnificent potato crisps. Now, even we would be hard pressed to describe knobbly looking root vegetables as elegant. But when simply sliced and briefly hand fried something of a transformation occurs. From humble beginnings comes a nibble charming and sophisticated enough for even the ritziest of get-togethers. So, Tyrrells and tipples anyone? English Eccentrics. Whether it's the great uncle who organised dinner parties for dogs, or the grandmother who lived in an underground mansion filled with wigs - we love an English eccentric. Do you have a friend or relative with habits that are, how shall we say, a little unconventional? If so, regale us with a story about them and if it's suitably gigglesome, we'll publish it on our fully-digital internet site and furnish you with some freebies. Just saunter over to www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk/eccentrics. For the chance to win one of 100 cases of our crisps every month, just sign up to become an Official Taste Tester on our internet website thingy: www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk. The Tyrrells Alternative Five-A-Day. Steamed broccoli, herbal tea, sit-ups: nothing terribly wrong with any of those (in moderation). But there is such a thing as taking it too far, you know. Which is why we came up with our own lifestyle guide, an alternative five-a-day. It's a simple list of things to keep your spirits up. Well, it works for us! A toasted tea cake. A snifter of port. A spot of sherry trifle. A game of Scrabble. A whole bag of English veg crisps. Tellus your alternative five-a-day at www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk and if we love it we'll pop it on our website and give you a little pressie.

product.productDescription: Pleasingly crinkly crisps inspired by the furrowed fields of our Herefordshire farm. Ridged for pleasure. Nothing artificial - MSG? No thank you! Vegan friendly - free from animals. Avoid embarrassment - serve Tyrrells. Sea salt&vinegar seasoned furrows potato crisps. Just a few quick potato-shaped words to kick things off. We're Tyrrells and we make fine English crisps here on our farm in Herefordshire. We cook them by hand in small batches and we always leave the jackets on. We reckon they're rather special, but don't take our word for it - dig in and let us know what you think. Nothing stirs the senses quite like the happy moment when sea salt greets its old friend, that most forthright of seasonings, vinegar. And if you like these, keep your eyes peeled for our other Furrows: Mature Cheddar&Pickled Onion and Sea Salted. English Eccentrics. Whether it's the local farmer who still tests the temperature of the ground with his bare bottom or the retired admiral who fires a cannon from his rooftop every day at noon - we love an English eccentric. Do you have a friend or relative with habits that are, how shall we say, a little unconventional? If so, regale us with a story about them and if it's suitably gigglesome, we'll publish it on our fully-digital internet site and furnish you with some freebies. Just saunter over to www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk/eccentrics. For the chance to win one of 100 cases of our crisps every month, just sign up to become an Official Taste Tester on our internet website thingy: www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk. The Tyrrells Alternative Five-A-Day. Steamed broccoli, herbal tea, sit-ups: nothing terribly wrong with any of those (in moderation). But there is such a thing as taking it too far, you know. Which is why we came up with our own lifestyle guide, an alternative five-a-day. It's a simple list of things to keep your spirits up. Well, it works for us! A wedge of game pie. A yomp in the mud. A slice of lardy cake. A right old giggle. A handful of Furrows. Tell us your alternative five-a-day at www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk and if we love it we'll pop it on our website and give you a little pressie.

Visit www.geetasfoods.com for great meal ideas, product information, news, competitions and to sign up to 'Geeta's Kitchen' monthly e-newsletter. You can also follow us on facebook.

They're oven baked, twice, for crunchiness and exceptional taste and because they're baked, they contain 70% less fat than potato crisps on average. Visit us at: www.walkers-baked.co.uk

Natural mineral spring water fortified with gas from the spring. The ultimate refreshment to quench all thirsts. The strength of Perrier's bubbles has conquered the world. A 750ml bottle, ideal for adding some seriously refreshing fizz to picnics, parties and family occasions. Natural mineral spring water fortified with gas from the spring. Perrier is the natural mineral water that sparkles like no other. Naturally carbonated, the unique combination of limestone filtration and rising volcanic gas causes Perrier mineral water to force its way up and out, rising at a spring named Les Bouillens, meaning \u2018boiling waters\u2019. Each bottle contains three times more gas than water \u2013 resulting in the strongest, most invigorating bubbles to be found in any natural mineral water. For over 100 years, people have visited the springs to enjoy the health-giving waters. Today, Perrier quenches and pleases all your senses, fizzing with vitality. Captured at source.

From our house to yours, a wonderfully balanced cup with notes of nuts and cocoa and a touch of sweetness from the roast. It's a hospitable blend of the finest Latin American beans that we've been offering to coffee lovers since the very beginning. A Better Cup of Coffee. We're committed to ethically sourcing and roasting the highest-quality Arabica coffee in the world. When we buy coffee this way, it fosters a better future for farmers, and a more stable climate for the planet. It also helps create a long-term supply of the high-quality beans we've been carefully blending, roasting and packing for more than 40 years. Find out more at starbucks.com/responsibility. This coffee is described as""Baluarte:- a special accolade bestowed by the Italian Slow Food movement upon exceptional quality foods that support social and environmental sustainability. Artisan Roasted: This 'top of the mountain' coffee is both beautiful and challenging to roast. Intimate knowledge of the farm allows our roastmaster to draw out the fruit and floral tones of this strong yet elegant bean. Union Story: Our journey began in the 90's with one pound of fresh roasted coffee from a local coffee roaster in San Francisco. Our senses were stirred by an explosion of flavours a skilled roastmaster coaxed from these special coffee beans. Inspired to start our own coffee roastingcompany back home in London, our dream was to provide like-minded souls with exceptionally good, fresh roasted coffee, just what we wanted to drink for ourselves. Full of beans and colourful vegetables with a kick of chipotle chilli. Yes! You've done it! You've taken the first step in creating a good life! A good life starts from within and this naturally delicious bean burger has been lovingly created by our chef Charlotte who, (like this dish) is also full of beans! Charlotte has been known to indulge in a bit of Spice Girls karaoke and now wants to spice up your life with this quarterpounder. Using mother nature's pulses and vegetables ensures our food lovesyou from the inside out and sets you up for the day to go about your business and do good things! In fact it's just what you've \u2018bean\u2019 waiting for!! Join our revolution! Live your life the goodlife way and help create a good life for everyone! Creating a good life is at the heart of everything we do. We are all busy cleaning, chopping, peeling and cooking to bring you the very best dishes which we promise are always naturally delicious and always meat and dairy free! We are all passionate about what we do and put a lot of time and love into our food so that all you have to do is simply pop it in the oven, freeing up time for you to create your own good life! Around the small Northern German town of Westerkappeln these delicious products have been baked in the Conditorei (Patisserie) of the Coppenrath and Wiese families for over 200 years. Our traditional recipes have been developed since then using all our confectionary skills combined with the freshest and finest ingredients. Wine of Spain. Cava Brut - White Spanish Wine. Codorniu Brut, a faithful reflection of the first cava created by Codorníu in 1872 which still maintains its original blend of the three traditional cava grape varieties: Macabeo, Xarel.lo and Parellada. Cava is made according to the Traditional Method. The second fermentation, to produce bubbles and the unique flavour, takes place in this bottle. A fresh, crisp ad elegant sparkling wine with attractive flavours of citrus and apple with fine, persistent bubbles.

Hints of spring flowers with a touch of toast and honey. This is followed by strong fruit and balancing citrus flavours. If there is one Non-Vintage Brut Champagne that is universally appreciated, it is surely Lanson Black Label, a great classic with a fresh and elegant style. With a history dating back to 1760 Champagne Lanson is the third oldest house in Champagne and was awarded the Royal Warrant in 1860 by Queen Victoria. Champagne is an historic province in the northeast of France, best known for the production of the sparkling white wine that bears the region's name. Lanson are of the few producers to prevent malolactic fermentation, keeping their wines crisp and refreshing. The wine then has extended ageing in the historical wine cellars to mature and soften.
A sparkling blend of white wine and orange juice. A zesty sparkling cocktail.
Waitrose St Emilion (75cl)

From Grapes of a single year, this champagne is matured for several years before release. M.CHAPOUTIER, founded in 1808, produce La Petite Ruche from the Crozes-Hermitage appellation in Northern Rhone. The wine expresses M. Chapoutiers' belief in creating wines that demonstrate complexity, finesse, and the << terroir >> of the Rhone valley. Made from the Syrah Grape variety and traditionally hand harvested, La Petite Ruche is a medium-bodied, fruit driven wine that is ready for drinking now.

A refreshingly crisp white, with fresh, zesty flavours of gooseberry and citrus, and the scent of freshly cut grass. Made from Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay grapes, grown in New Zealand's Marlborough region, widely considered to produce the best Sauvignon Blanc in the world. Good with fish, seafood, chicken and salads.

To extract the most flavoursome part of the Stevia plant, dried Stevia leaves are boiled in hot water after which the liquid is purified and filtered before being crystallised and dried. product.productName: Tyrrell's crinkly veg crisps rosemary & garlic -
product.productDescription: Coveted by cord wearers. Nothing artificial - MSG? No thank you! Gluten free - just in case you were wondering. Vegetarian friendly - free from animals. Avoid embarrassment - serve Tyrrells. Crinkle cut beetroot, parsnip&carrot crisps with rosemary&wild garlic. For years we wondered what would happen if we were to take our very favourite root veg and put them through our very favourite contraption - The Crinkler. Well, finally we caved in, and gosh we're glad we did. Sweet, earthy root veg cut to a thick and gratifying crinkle... goodness! Our only regret: we should have done it yonks ago. A staggeringly colourful combo of carrots, parsnips and beetroots, cut to a crinkle, fried to a crisp, and lent a herbaceous kick courtesy of our good friends rosemary and wild garlic. English Eccentrics. Do you have English ancestors? If so, have a rummage around at home, and if you find any eccentric old photos of them, get in touch. You never know, old Auntie Ivy could be the next face of Tyrrells. Pop along to upload your piccies at www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk/eccentrics. The Tyrrells Alternative Five-A-Day. Steamed broccoli, herbal tea, sit-ups: nothing terribly wrong with any of those (in moderation). But there is such a thing as taking it too far, you know. Which is why we came up with our own lifestyle guide, an alternative five-a-day. It's a simple list of things to keep your spirits up. Well, it works for us! A slice of swiss roll. A leftover roast potato. A glass of barley water. A go on the swings. A handful of crinkly veg crisps

Smashing on a Sunday. Nothing artificial - MSG? No thank you! Gluten free - just in case you were wondering. Vegan friendly - free from animals. Great taste gold 09. Parsnip crisps seasoned with black pepper&sea salt. Now, even we would be hard pressed to describe knobbly looking root vegetables as elegant. But when simply sliced and briefly hand fried something of a transformation occurs. From humble beginnings comes a nibble charming and sophisticated enough for even the ritziest of get-togethers. So, Tyrrells and tipples anyone? A crunchy celebration of that most agreeable Sunday-ish of root veggies, the mighty parsnip - with just a sprinkling of sea salt and black pepper for company. And if you like these, keep your eyes peeled for our magnificent potato crisps. English Eccentrics. Do you have English ancestors? If so, have a rummage around at home, and if you find any eccentric old photos of them, get in touch. You never know, old Auntie Ivy could be the next face of Tyrrells. Pop along to upload your piccies at www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk/eccentrics. For the chance to win one of 100 cases of our crisps every month, just sign up to become an Official Taste Tester on our internet website thingy: www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk. The Tyrrells Alternative Five-A-Day. Steamed broccoli, herbal teas, sit-ups: nothing terribly wrong with any of those (in moderation). But there is such a thing as taking it too far, you know. Which is why we came up with our own lifestyle guide, an alternative five-a-day. It's a simple list of things to keep your spirits up. Well, it works for us! A glass of homemade lemonade. An English muffin. A generous serving of rhubarb crumble. A Sunday snooze. A big helping of English veg crisps. Tell us your alternative five-a-day at www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk and if we love it we'll pop it on our website and give you a little pressie.

Compressed - lasts as long with less packaging. Motionsense system. Long lasting anti-perspirant. Body movement = extra protection. Suremen Active captures the masculine scent of skin just scrubbed clean with soapy lather. Containing motionsense\u2122 technology, each time your body temperature rises microcapsules are released to give you that just-showered feeling for up to 48 hours. How do Compressed deodorants work? Convenience of a pant, dryness of a nappy. 1 pack = 1 life-saving vaccine. The perfect transition from nappies to pants. Extra Dry-Layer for Pampers dryness. For every specially marked Pampers pack purchased, Pampers will donate the cost of one life-saving vaccine to help protect a mum and her newborn from tetanus. *For each Pampers pack with the UNICEF logo purchased, Procter&Gamble supports UNICEF in the fight against newborn tetanus with 4.4p/\u20AC0.054. This amount equals, for example, the cost of one tetanus vaccine or supports its delivery. UNICEF does not endorse any brand or product. product.productName: Huggies Pull Ups Potty Training Pants, Girl, Medium 11-18kg -
product.productDescription: Huggies®Pull-Ups®make potty training more fun and easier! Here's how: 1. They are slim and fit like underwear, with super stretchy sides they're easy for your toddler to pull up&down...like big kid pants! 2. Huggies®Pull-Ups®have learning graphics, they fade when wet&help little ones to see the difference between wet&dry. 3. With Disney Cars, Princesses and Minnie designs, the graphics make Huggies®Pull-Ups®look like fun big kid underwear. 4. The Easy-Open sides make it easy for Mum to check little accidents and remove as necessary. Huggies®Pull-Ups®potty training pants are available in nappy sizes Small (S), Medium (M) and Large (L) in both a Day-time and Night-time range. For more information please visit www.pottytraining.co.uk

A unique collection of 16 delicious chocolate recipes, crafted with passion by the Lindt Master Chocolatier. Caramel Praline. Delicate praline with crunchy caramelised flakes dipped in our signature milk chocolate. Hazelnut Cup. A milk chocolate cup filled with velvet smooth gianduja and a whole hazelnut. Crème Brûlée. Soft vanilla cream and crunchy caramel pieces in a milk chocolate cup. Feuillantine Praline. Smooth milk chocolate praline with a light crispy bite. Dark Praline. Contrast of smooth praline and crispy wafer dipped in intense dark chocolate. Almond Praline. Milk chocolate with almond pieces around a nutty praline centre. Dark Ganache. Our signature dark chocolate ganache with 70% cocoa. Toffee Truffle. Creamy salted caramel blended with soft milk chocolate truffle. Raspberry Ganache. Deeply sophisticated dark chocolate ganache infused with essence of raspberry. Milk Caramel. Smooth liquid caramel encased in velvety milk chocolate shell. Almond Truffle. Tempting milk chocolate soft almond truffle wrapped in dark chocolate. Tiramisu. White and milk chocolate with a hint of creamy coffee and a touch of biscuit. Dark Caramel. Intense dark chocolate filled with a velvety liquid caramel centre. (Only available in 305g box). White Chocolate Swirl. Crunchy meringue pieces hidden in sweet white chocolate. Orange&Hazelnut Praline. Tangy orange praline smothered in dark chocolate with crunchy hazelnut pieces. Coffee Ganache. Velvety smooth dark chocolate ganache with the intensity of real coffee. (Only available in 305g box). Lindt&Sprüngli. Master Swiss chocolatier since 1845. Driven by the passion of the Master Chocolatiers, Lindt has been creating some of the world's finest chocolates since 1845. This special gift contains an exquisite collection of luxury chocolates that will delight even the most discerning chocolate connoisseur. With an irresistible array of textures and flavours to please every palate, this is the ultimate in beautifully crafted chocolate indulgence. A joy to give, a delight to receive... product.productName: Denhay dry cured back unsmoked bacon -
product.productDescription: We only use British outdoor bred pigs from freedom food assured farms. Traditionally dry cured by hand, using sea salt. Multi award-winning bacon, slowly matured and full of flavour. Taste of the West Awards 2011 - best bacon. Great taste gold 2011. Freedom Food RSPCA monitored. Unsmoked Back Bacon. British outdoor bred pork. Hand rubbed with sea salt and slowly matured for a full flavour. Denhay was founded by two farming families - the Hoods and the Streatfeilds - Dorset's Marshwood Vale in 1952. Today we proudly display their combined coats of arms on each Denhay pack as a guarantee that it contains only the very best bacon. Our traditional methods use only fresh British outdoor bred pork. We cure it by hand with sea salt and then allow the pork to mature slowly before slicing, resulting in wonderfully full flavoured and succulent rashers of bacon.

It is extracted from a speciallycultivated evening primrose, the seeds of which contain up to 33% more Gamma Linolenic Acid (GLA) than other oils. GLA is an Omega-6 nutrient found naturally in evening primrose oil. Research shows that it isn't just the quantity of GLA that's important - it's the quality. Efamol captures the essence of both. Evening Primrose Oil May Help. Support nourished looking skin. Keep skin looking healthy, smooth and with a natural glow. Maintain the skin's natural elasticity. There are two families of 'good fats' - the Omega-6 family and Omega-3 family. Whilst some 'good fats' can be made by the body, factors such as age, diet and excess saturated fats can reduce the body's efficiency in converting them from food. With today's busy lifestyles sometimes we don't always get enough of what is good for us. Following a varied and balanced diet can help ensure adequate intake of these 'good fats'. That's why it is important to invest in yourself. Based on extensive scientific research to ensure the right balance, Efamol have carefully formulated a range of products designed to safeguard your dietary intake of essential fatty acids. product.productDescription: Helps maintain strong bones&a healthy body. Easy to swallow tablets. Recommended for women of all ages. Gluten, lactose&yeast free. No artificial flavours or preservatives. The energy value of carbohydrate, protein&fat contained in this product is negligible. Suitable for vegetarians. Food supplement. The Calcium supplement with Vitamin D, Iron and Multivitamins. Calcia original is a unique formulation of calcium to help build and maintain strong bones with key vitamins and iron essential for a healthy body. Although we stop growing in height in our late teens, our bones continue to strengthen&thicken well into our mid thirties. After this time we start to lose calcium from our bones faster than we can replace it, especially around the time of the menopause. An excessive loss of bone tissue (bone density) can lead toan increased risk of bone fractures, particularly as we get older. Supplementing your diet with calcium may help keep bone density levels high. Your diet may not provide the calcium you need, particularly if you do not eat dairy products, miss meals, smoke, or drink excess alcohol. Calcia provides the optimum amount of calcium (equivalent to over 1 pint of milk) with vitamin D to aid its absorption. Research shows that a balanced intake of calcium throughout life is crucial for the healthy development&maintenance of your bones. In addition, it contains iron and vitamin B12 for healthy blood formation, with vitamin C to hep absorb then iron. Vitamin B1, B2 and B6 are also included to help maintain your hormone balance and help in the release of energy from food.

product.productDescription: 100% Manuka Honey plus acai, cherry, cranberry. No added sugar or stabilizers.The world\u2019s first pure Manuka Honey lozenge made from New Zealand Manuka Honey blended with tart montmorency cherry juice, tangy cranberry juice and a pinch of freeze dried acai berry. We don't add sugar or any artificial ingredients so you can enjoy the flavours as nature intended.The fruity flavour of cherry and acai is complemented by gentle notes of cranberry underpinned by the soothing and distinctive taste of manuka honey and appeals to children and adults alike.Explaining the activity rating of Manuka Honey: Not all Manuka Honey has unique therapeutic properties. The activity rating (e.g. 12+) shows the unique type of antibacterial activity which is naturally present in honey made from the nectar of the Manuka bush (Leptospermum scoparium). The activity numbers for Manuka Honey can be confusing. The golden numbers for anti-bacterial effectiveness are between 10+ and 15+. A rating below 10+ has no proven unique therapeutic benefit whilst honey with extremely high activity levels may have been over-processed.Green Bay Harvest 12+ Manuka Honeysucker Lozenges are designed for:Fighting Infection and inflammation: known to combat over 60 bacteria and fungi, the antibacterial action of manuka honey is highly stable.Mouth and Throat Care: The antiseptic properties help kill bacteria which cause sore throats whilst the honey soothes the throat without numbing it. Many singers and speakers take our lozenges as a vocal care product.Coughs and Colds: Honey is a traditional remedy for coughs and colds particularly when combined with lemon. Sore throats caused by bacterial infections can be soothed by the antibacterial properties in Manuka Honey whilst the honey helps suppress coughing and aid a good night\u2019s sleep.Digestion: By coating and soothing the gastro-intestinal tract, active Manuka Honey shields the gut from damaging conditions such as acid reflux.Non-diabetic Hypoglycemia: Many people snack on biscuits when they feel their blood sugar lever is low. Honeysuckers are an ideal alternative and can easily be kept with you during the day.Child Friendly: These lozenges taste delicious because they are made with pure honey and don\u2019t contain refined sugar or artificial flavourings or additives. So they appeal to children with sore throats and coughs who can safely eat throat lozenges.A note from JoManuka Honey was one of the first foods we started to bring to the UK as it is a perfect example of a natural food with amazing benefits, as well as one that is easy to incorporate into our usual diet.Some time ago, as medical trials continued to prove the value of Manuka Honey I was introduced to a fellow honey lover who was trying to create a patented process for drying Manuka Honey. It was not easy but after much trial and error, together we brought the world\u2019s first Manuka Honey lozenge to the UK. Now the Green Bay Harvest Manuka Honeysucker range is av

Brightening vitamin C. Dermatologically tested. Dark Spot Corrector. Whatever your age, repeated exposure to the sun, ageing, hormonal fluctuations and blemishes can all be responsible for the appearance of dark spots, age spots and marks on the skin's surface which leave it looking dull and uneven. Is Dark Spot Corrector right for me? Yes, if you are looking for a daily skincare product that helps correct by visibly reducing the appearance of discolourations: dark spots, age spots and blemish marks that accumulate on the skin. You're looking for skin that looks more even and luminous in one single step. How is it different? Garnier creates Dark Spot Corrector, a daily skincare product that evens skintone, reduces the appearance of dark spots and illuminates, whilst giving intense 24hr moisturisation. How does it work? The light, non-greasy formula is highly concentrated in pure Vitamin C, known for it's anti-oxidant and brightening* properties. With use, discolourations appear faded: it visibly reduces the appearance of dark spots, age spots, blemish marks and evens skin tone. Skin is luminous, radiant and looks beautiful even without make-up. The formula has been developed to suit all skin types. The power of vitamin C to take care of your skin. Known for its anti-oxidant and brightening* action, we have taken vitamin C - highly concentrated at 5% - to help fight against the appearance of dark spots and restore skin's radiance. *In vitro test. Effective result: Immediately skin feels soft, moisturised and looks more luminous. In 4 weeks**: Dark spots and imperfections appear reduced for 73% of women. Skin tone is more even and less dull for 85% of women. Skin is more moisturised for 86% of women. Clinical tests*** prove it: In 8 weeks: the size of dark spots appear reduced. In 12 weeks: the size of dark spots appear diminished. ** Consumer test - 109 people. ***Clinical grading test - 107 people. This product contains pure vitamin C and may turn brown on contact with air. This does not alter the efficacy or safety of the formula. After each use, thoroughly clean the tip of the tube before closing it. Our Garnier Skin Naturals Philosophy. We use, wherever possible, naturally derived active ingredients which have been carefully extracted to preserve their quality and purity. Formulated and dermatologically tested to ensure their effectiveness and respect for your skin.

Our Blanc de Noirs Champagne is made by a quality conscious family Champagne house and entirely from Pinot Noir grapes. Only the top cuvee from the first pressing of grapes is used. A stylish dry wine with ripe fruit and a biscuity finish, its full flavours make it ideal as an aperitif or as a match for light dishes.

Wine of England. Quality Sparkling Wine. Tasting Notes. Vibrant antique red rose colour, hint of copper tones, lovely tiny bubbles. Red mango, honey, hints of star anise, cardamom and alyssum. Red liquorice, red cherry&currant flavours. High intensity, with lovely round and full but soft texture. Finish is very long and full with red currant and hints of shortcrust pastry. The monthly mean temperatures correspond precisely to the monthly averages of the last decade. As a result, the vines progressed as expected. Flowering started around the middle of June under good conditions, véraison during the last week of August, and harvest early in October. Thanks to the fine weather in August (40% less rain compared to the average) and September (30% less), the status of the grapes was good, which enabled us to pick them at their optimum ripeness, with the luxury of being able to pick fruit the end of October. Since there was no frost damage and the fruit set was excellent, the 2009 yield was the highest ever recorded. For over 25 years Nyetimber has had a single aim: to make the finest English sparkling wine, one to rival the very best in the very best in the world, including Champagne. A true pioneer, Nyetimber was the very first producer of English sparkling wine to craft wines made exclusively from the three celebrated varieties found in Champagne: Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay. In 1988, Nyetimber planted its first vines and today, the House is regarded as one of England's finest wine producers. Owner Eric Heerema and winemaker Cherie Spriggs are committed to producing wines of a Grande Marque standard. Each bottle of Nyetimber is crafted from one hundred percent of estate-grown grapes. Nyetimber uses only its own grapes from its own vineyards, each of which was deliberately selected to be south-facing sandy or chalk soils similar in composition to those found in Champagne. All Nyetimber vineyards are located in the lee of the South Downs which affords them shelter from the coastal winds. Prior to harvest, the grapes are tasted to ensure the best flavour development before picking. Every single grape is picked by hand at the optimal time, a decision that is made on a parcel by parcel basis.

Wine of LimaríValley, Chile. Shiraz - Red Chilean Wine. Viña Tabalílies beside the edge of Valle del Encanto, a magical place where ancient cultures such as Diaguitas and Molles held ceremonies and rituals. The presence of Rupestrian art, through Petroglyphs and Pictographs, are proof of their mystic way of life.

Wine of Chile. Cabernet Sauvignon - Red Chilean Wine. Winemaker's Notes. A smooth, full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon with cassis and black cherry flavours, complemented by hints of coffee and dark chocolate. ""More than 100 years ago, Don Melchor de Concha y Toro reserved for himself an exclusive batch of his best wines. To keep strangers away from his private reserve, he spread the rumor that the Devil lived in that place. Hence the name: Casillero Del Diablo, The Devil's Cellar"".

It is a thoroughly modern French wine with anintensely fruity nose that offers rich aromas of plum and a waft of wild herbs. The palate is smooth, soft and satisfying. Enjoy it with a steak or roast beef and any full flavoured Mediterranean cuisine. Sea breezes through our Malbec vines temper the warm Mediterranean sun creating idyllic growing conditions. Rich, dark bramble and plummy fruit flavours distinguish this smooth red wine. It is a great match for steak. Thierry Boudinaud - Winemaker

Original milk protein. Pasteurised standardised homogenised whole milk. The natural answer to A1 milk protein intolerance. a2\u2122 Milk is a natural great tasting cows milk with all the goodness milk brings. Cows milk contains different types of protein, one group of which are caseins - the main types of the beta-casein fraction are A2 and A1. a2\u2122 Milk does not contain the A1 protein as it comes from specially selected cows which naturally produce only A2 protein. The structural difference between A2 and A1 proteins means they may digest differently. People who experience symptoms of intolerance to milk may be reacting specifically to the A1 protein and not the lactose in milk or other milk proteins as is often assumed. a2\u2122 Milk is not a modified milk nor is it a dairy alternative but it is a cows milk naturally containing A2 protein and therefore the natural answer to A1 milk protein intolerance.

Gunpowder green tea is named for its appearance: the dark green tea leaves are rolled by hand into tiny pellets that resemble gunpowder. Traditionally, Moroccan Mint is valued as a digestive aid. product.productName: Dragonfly rooibos earl grey caffeine free 40 tea bags -
product.productDescription: Same great taste. With classically fragrant finest oil of bergamot. Naturally caffeine free. Earl grey rooibos tea. Rooibos (or Redbush) is a full-flavoured, naturally caffeine free tea that grows only in South Africa's remote Cedarberg mountains. Gently hydrating and low in tannin, it has long been valued for its natural goodness. Made naturally in the fresh mountain air, when Rooibos is ready to drink it gives off a deliciously sweet scent that delights the local honey bees. We only use the finest oil of Bergamot. This gives Dragonfly Earl Grey Rooibos the authentic Earl Grey taste. Delicious, aromatic and naturally caffeine free. At Dragonfly, we are a family company dedicated to bringing you artisanal, exquisite and often rare teas from around the world. All the ingredients in our delicious naturally caffeine free Rooibos range have been carefully selected for purity and flavour. Earl Grey Rooibos, Breakfast Rooibos, Vanilla Rooibos. We have over 30 fine and unusual teas in our range which are available for you to buy online. Dragonfly is committed to quality without compromise. We use only the finest natural ingredients. We never use artificial additives, preservatives, colourants or GM crops. Dragonflies are symbols of purity, vitality and harmony the world over. They love sunlight and clear fresh water. We believe that these qualities are essential for a truly great cup. Discover them and more tea insight by visiting www.dragonflyteas.com

Dragonfly Teas use only the finest quality, pure organic teas, herbs and spices.

product.productName: Dragonfly Organic Swirling Mist White Tea 20 sachets -
product.productDescription: OrganicPure teas - no compromiseCamellia sinensis var. Fuding DabaiThis authentic Bai Mudan white tea, known as white peony, is one of the great teas of China. Named for the silvery white down that covers the underside of the leaves, it is grown in the high mountain mists of Fujian province. In spring, the tender shoots are carefully selected and skilfully cured, a natural process that has been perfected over centuries. In traditional Chinese medicine, Bai Mudan white tea is saidto refresh, detoxify and bring the immune system into balance.Taste refreshing, subtle, with a characteristic nutty taste.Dragonfly Teas use only the finest quality, pure organic teas, herbs and spices.

Why not try adding them to a Traditional North African Tagine sauce and add rice or Cous Cous to create a mouthwatering dish sure to set the taste buds tingling? Made with all natural ingredients and no additives or preservative our Falafels not only taste good but do you good too! Creating a good life is at the heart of everything we do. We are all busy cleaning, chopping, peeling and cooking to bring you the very best dishes which we promise are always naturally delicious and always meat and dairy free! We are all passionate about what we do and put a lot of time and love into our food so that all you have to do is simply pop it in the oven, freeing up time for you to create your own good life! So we've set out 10 easy principles and created deliciously balanced products rich in variety to help you eat better forever. And by only including wholesome ingredients that release nutrients slowly into your body, you'll stay satisfied and full of energy for longer. Follow The Food Doctor and you will eat better forever. Principle no.9 of our 10 principles for eating better forever. STOP&EAT. Taking time out to eat will help you enjoy your food more whilst getting the maximum goodness and pleasure from your meals. We've been making our delicious pasta in the UK since 1929 when a young Luigi Ugo came to London from Italy and started making fresh pasta by hand to sell to local hotels and restaurants. We were also the first to introduce gnocchi into the market in 1932... and now the first to bring gnocchetti to these shores. We're still a family business today and continue to make and supply fresh pasta, gnocchi and other delicious Italian foods with pride and passion. Buxton Natural Mineral Water is utterly pure and full of vitality \u2013 helping you make the most out of every day. Buxton water is rainfall from over 5000 years ago, which has slowly filtered through the ancient limestone of the Derbyshire Peak District. Deep underground, the water changes course and rises up through 1500 metres of British bedrock to emerge, crisp and delicious, in Buxton. This natural filtration makes Buxton one of the purest natural mineral waters in Europe. Buxton mineral water naturally rises to the top, brimming with vigour. Just like you. Bottled at source in Buxton, England. Not just another pretty bottle... We are sure you felt the difference when you picked up your Buxton. It has been made with 25% less plastic* and is still fully recyclable. But we haven't stopped there... Our aim is to continuously reduce our impact on the environment by cutting our water and energy use. See what we've been up to at www.buxtonwater.co.uk. *average PET reduction for new bottle range versus old.

Legend has it that in 1509 Leonardo Da Vinci traced the source and produced a map of the region. In 1748, the water was analysed \u2013 and its pure composition is still identical today. Made in Italy.

Traditionally used for over-indulgence, indigestion and upset stomach. Standardised fruit extract. A traditional herbal medicinal product used to relieve the symptoms associated with occasional over-indulgence of drink and food, based on traditional use only.

William Ransom&Son Producers of Superfruits Juices. WINNER OF THE HEALTH FOOD INDUSTRY. PRODUCT AWARDS 2006. May help maintain a healthy heart as part of a balanced diet. ANTIOXIDANT ENRICHED (OXY 3\u2122). SUPER OXY3\u2122 ULTIMATE ANTIOXIDANT COMPLEX. Acai berries come from palm trees that are indigenous to the Brazilian rainforest. For hundreds of years the small dark berries have been integral to the diet of native Amazon people, promoting overall wellbeing. Acai berries contain extraordinary levels of Anthocyanins, a powerful antioxidant as well as essential fatty acids that can help reduce cholesterol when used as part of a balanced diet. Acai berries also contain a host of other beneficial nutrients including vitamins, minerals, amino acids and phytosterols. Acai is widely acknowledged to have one of the highest nutritional values of any fruit, hence its association with the term 'superfood'. Acai Superfruit Juice is enriched with OXY3\u2122, a unique combination of three natural occurring compounds rich in free radical scavenging antioxidants; Red Grape, Lycopene and Resveratrol. Red Grape has numerous health benefits, particularly due to the dark skin that contains high levels of flavonoids and anthocyanins which are a good source of antioxidants. Lycopene is the main carotenoid found in tomatoes giving the distinctive red colour. Lycopene contains a high level of antioxidants. Resveratrol naturally occurs in some plants and fruits in response to injury or fungal infection. Resveratrol is high in antioxidants and has also been shown to help reduce cholesterol in conjunction with a healthy lifestyle.

Farmer Owned Since 1930. Hello, we're the Gilmore family... We are farmer owned Cooperative who live and breathe cranberries. Premium London Dry gin distilled from 100% neutral grain spirit. Mediterranean lemon peel, juniper berries, almonds and orris, coriander, liquorice, angelica and cassia bark, cubeb berries and grains of paradise combine for a crisp, delicately balanced taste.

Free from wheat. English potato vodka. Crowned Best Vodka and awarded double gold at the World San Francisco Spirits Competition. Chase is Britain's first and only potato vodka. Distilled five times in our handcrafted copper still and 70ft rectification column, being chill filtered and hand bottled - all on our farm in the heart of Herefordshire.

Chivas Regal. 12 year old premium Scotch whisky. Chivas Regal has long been the world's favourite 12 year old Scotch whisky, renowned for its great taste. At Chivas Brothers, the Master Blender's art lies in his skilful selection of malt and grain whiskies in the Chivas Regal blend. Of these, malts from Speyside are at the heart of the famous rich, mellow taste. Enjoy the great taste of Chivas Regal, blended for a refined smoothness.

Matured in seasoned oak casks. A marriage of finest Scotch whiskies. No. 1 blended Scotch whisky in the UK* - A phenomenal achievement. No. 1 in Scotland for over 30 years, with three drams sold every second**. Contains some of the world's finest whiskies, including The Macallan and Highland Park - Unsurpassed quality. High proportion of ex-sherry casks used - Creates a distinct, smooth and well rounded dram. Over 15 years of TV advertising in the UK - A much loved icon instantly recognisable to drinkers. Contains the Royal Seal of approval - Endorsement of the highest quality. *Nielsen 2/2/13, CGA 29/12/12. **Nielsen December 2008. Blended Scotch whisky. The Famous Grouse is named after the Red Grouse, Scotland's national game bird. Its smooth taste comes from blending fine malt whiskies - including The Macallan and Highland Park - and sweet grain whiskies. And it's Scotland's Favourite Whisky. For some, that would be cause for celebration. For The Famous Grouse, it's simply the reward for a job well done. Cheers. Appearance. Full golden, clear and bright. Nose. Well-balanced oak. Sherry with a citrus hint. Palate. Medium-full flavour of chocolate orange, vanilla and dried fruits. Finish. Good length, clean and medium dry. In 1896, The Famous Grouse was born. A little different from the start, Matthew Gloag named it after Scotland's national game bird, the red grouse, trademarking it as The Famous Grouse on 12th August 1905. History and Heritage. Origin/Location. The Famous Grouse represents the very best of Scotland and contains some of the world's finest malts (including Highland Park and The Macallan). Is married and bottled in Glasgow. Has its spiritual home in Crieff at Glenturret - Scotland's oldest and most visited distillery. Owned by an independent company headquartered in Perth. History. Matthew Gloag established his much-respected family grocers in 1800. Decades later, third generation Matthew Gloag introduced a whisky that would become known for doing things differently. Discerning gents visiting the Highlands for outdoor sports came to experience the fine dram that became The Famous Grouse in 1896. By Appointment to Her Majesty the Queen Scotch Whisky Blenders Matthew Gloag&Son Limited.
Brown-Forman Beverages Europe Ltd.,. Vodka of Finland

Imperial quality standard. Distilled&bottled in Russia. Vodka. At the Imperial Court in St Petersburg, the Tsars of Russia were legendary for demanding only the finest in luxury and quality. Their national spirit, vodka, was no exception. In 1894, Dmitri Mendeleev, the greatest scientist in all Russia received the decree to set the Imperial quality standard for Russian vodka and the 'Russian Standard' was born. Today, in St Petersburg, our state-of-the-art distillery allows us to bring this vodka heritage into the 21st Century. Using winter wheat from the Russian Steppes, pure glacial water from Lake Ladoga and advanced distillation technology, we have created the genuine taste of Russian vodka that is once again being celebrated throughout the world.

Grown, distilled and bottled in Herefordshire, England. Marmalade vodka. We marinade our award winning Chase vodka with the finest Seville orange marmalade in our beautiful copper pot still. We then distill a fourth time with the vapours passing through fresh orange peel, to create this complicated and totally natural orange experience. The finished spirit is clear with a golden hue. Strong orange zest on the nose with a naturally rich bitter-sweet flavour.

Hand cooked vegetable chips. Absolutely nothing artificial. We don't add MSG. We never use artificial flavours or colours. We don't use hydrogenated fat - a significant source of trans fat. We know the origin of all our ingredients. We only use sunflower oil. Suitable for vegans and vegetarians. Lightly salted hand cooked parsnip, sweet potato and beetroot chips. We like to keep things simple... We always insist on using the best vegetables we can find and hand cook them with care in small batches. The tangiest bbq flavour this side of Texas.Popchips. Never fried. Never baked. Popchips are popped! Our chips have all the flavour but less than half the fat of regular fried crisps*. And less than 100 calories per bag!Lately, all this low-fat health talk has been taking the fun out of snacking, not to mention the flavour. So we found a way to put it back into a naturally delicious chip like you've never tasted before. We don't fry it (unhealthy). We don't bake it (undelicious). Iron also plays a key role in helping to maintain a healthy immune system and sustain concentration levels. Spatone Apple simply combines 100% natural iron-rich water sourced from the mountains of Snowdonia, with a delicious apple taste and added vitamin C. product.productDescription: 12+ Manuka Honey with refreshing lemon - a traditional cold remedy.The world\u2019s first pure Manuka Honey lozenge - made from 100% raw, New Zealand Manuka Honey blended with zesty lemon juice and soothing lemon oil.Explaining the activity rating of Manuka Honey: Not all Manuka Honey has unique therapeutic properties. The activity rating (e.g. 12+) shows the unique type of antibacterial activity which is naturally present in honey made from the nectar of the Manuka bush (Leptospermum scoparium).The activity numbers for Manuka Honey can be confusing. The golden numbers for anti-bacterial effectiveness are between 10+ and 15+. A rating below 10+ has no proven unique therapeutic benefit whilst honey with extremely high activity levels may have been over-processed.Green Bay Harvest 12+ Manuka Honeysucker Lozenges are designed for:Fighting Infection and inflammation: known to combat over 60 bacteria and fungi, the antibacterial action of Manuka Honey is highly stable.Mouth and Throat Care: The antiseptic properties help kill bacteria which cause sore throats whilst the honey soothes the throat without numbing it. Many singers and speakers take our lozenges as a vocal care product.Coughs and Colds: Honey is a traditional remedy for coughs and colds particularly when combined with lemon. Sore throats caused by bacterial infections can be soothed by the antibacterial properties in Manuka Honey whilst the honey helps suppress coughing and aid a good night\u2019s sleep.Digestion: By coating and soothing the gastro-intestinal tract, active Manuka Honey shields the gut from damaging conditions such as acid reflux.Non-diabetic Hypoglycemia: Many people snack on biscuits when they feel their blood sugar lever is low. Honeysuckers are an ideal alternative and can easily be kept with you during the day.Child Friendly: These lozenges taste delicious because they are made with pure honey and don\u2019t contain refined sugar or artificial flavourings or additives. So they appeal to children with sore throats and coughs who can safely eat throat lozenges.A note from JoManuka Honey was one of the first foods we started to bring to the UK as it is a perfect example of a natural food with amazing benefits, as well as one that is easy to incorporate into our usual diet.Some time ago, as medical trials continued to prove the value of Manuka Honey I was introduced to a fellow honey lover who was trying to create a patented process for drying Manuka Honey. It was not easy but after much trial and error, together we brought the world\u2019s first Manuka Honey lozenge to the UK. Now the Green Bay Harvest Manuka Honeysucker range is available in five delicious flavours in 10 countries.Our Manuka Honey is harvested from hives situated in remote and wild parts of New Zealand. The bees are responsibly managed by the beekeepers with whom we work to optimise the health of the colony and the purity of the products from the hives.We test each barrel of honey on a range of qua

Butcher's Choice is a complete nutritious pet food for adult dogs. Our story... We are family run business with a passion for happy, healthy dogs and this inspired our original recipes over 25 years ago. We pride ourselves on using only the most nutritious and delicious ingredients. This means no artificial colourings or flavours. We believe what we leave out of our food is just as important as what we put in... we don't bulk out our recipes with soya or cereals, so they are gluten-free too.
